actions.recommendation: -Blood pressure is high at 144/91, please consult your doctor for review.
-BMI at 30.6 & waist-to-height ratio at 56.0% are high. This increases your risk of diseases such as hypertension.
-Decrease your weight to keep BMI between 18.5- 24.9 and waist-to-height ratio below 50%.
-Monitor blood pressure frequently and start treatment at your doctor's discretion.
-To improve cholesterol, limit foods high in saturated & trans fats, exercise more often and consider supplements like Rychol.
-Choose wholegrains and complex carbs. Limiting portion sizes and intermittent fasting may help lower insulin levels.
-Supplement with 50 000iu vitamin D weekly, aim for levels above 20ng/ml.
-Repeat blood tests in 3 months to assess for improvement.
